content: quote: Originally posted by Canuck_Centaur: quote: "Most cruises offer a mini-bar We offer a mounted Mini-Gun" ++http://www.somalicruises.com Anyone remember the TV series, "American Sportsmen?" content: I wouldn't be too fast to jump on this cruise. Remember what happened to a company of Rangers when they went up against these Pirates and these same pirates held off the most powerful Navy in the world for 5 days just a month ago. Be careful what you wish for. Right now the only three people in the world that I believe can handle this pirate situation is Obama, Pelosi, and Flat Jacks. Period.

content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: I wouldn't be too fast to jump on this cruise. Remember what happened to a company of Rangers when they went up against these Pirates and these same pirates held off the most powerful Navy in the world for 5 days just a month ago. Be careful what you wish for. Right now the only three people in the world that I believe can handle this pirate situation is Obama, Pelosi, and Flat Jacks. Period. Now, now. This is serious sport. This is not people armed with semi-automatic weapons going after dangerous wild chickens. If you want a trophy head, you're going to have to earn it. Maybe there will be leagues formed? Degree of difficulty? Will bow-hunting be allowed, where you get extra bonus points? Of course, "eating what you kill" will be a no no, one small adjustment to the "game" being hunted. No doubt that the expression, "Crazy Americans" will have a new lease on life. Catches on, it might very well end the pirate problem. Maybe limits on the kill? Size limits? No hunting on weekends? Boone and Crockett will just have to open up and estabish a weighing station in the area. Dave
